REQ-SEC-001.title: Starting Sectors
REQ-SEC-001.notes: Foundational spec - defines starting configuration. References resource types (Credits, Food, Ore, Petroleum) from RESOURCE system.

REQ-SEC-002.title: Sector Cost Scaling

blockers.reason: Formula uses current sector count which starts at 5 from REQ-SEC-001

REQ-SEC-002.notes: Cost formula depends on starting sector count but can work standalone with default value.

REQ-SEC-003.title: Eight Sector Types (Split)
REQ-SEC-003.notes: Parent spec for sector type definitions. References resources from RESOURCE system and research points from RESEARCH system.

REQ-SEC-003-01.title: Food Sector Type
REQ-SEC-003-01.notes: Produces Food resource defined in RESOURCE system.

REQ-SEC-003-02.title: Ore Sector Type
REQ-SEC-003-02.notes: Produces Ore resource defined in RESOURCE system.

REQ-SEC-003-03.title: Petroleum Sector Type
REQ-SEC-003-03.notes: Produces Petroleum resource defined in RESOURCE system.

REQ-SEC-003-04.title: Commerce Sector Type
REQ-SEC-003-04.notes: Produces Credits resource defined in RESOURCE system.

REQ-SEC-003-05.title: Urban Sector Type
REQ-SEC-003-05.notes: Provides population capacity and produces Credits from RESOURCE system.

REQ-SEC-003-06.title: Education Sector Type
REQ-SEC-003-06.notes: Provides civil status boost - intangible benefit with no cross-system dependencies.

REQ-SEC-003-07.title: Government Sector Type
REQ-SEC-003-07.notes: Provides agent capacity for COVERT system operations.

REQ-SEC-003-08.title: Research Sector Type
REQ-SEC-003-08.notes: Provides research points for RESEARCH system tech tree progression.

REQ-SEC-004.title: Production Timing (Split)

blockers.reason: Must know what sectors produce before calculating production timing

REQ-SEC-004.notes: Parent spec for production timing. Depends on TURN system for turn boundary processing.

REQ-SEC-004-A.title: Turn Boundary Production Timing

blockers.reason: Requires sector production values to process at turn boundary

REQ-SEC-004-A.notes: Server-side turn processing depends on TURN system.

blockers.reason: Delay rule applies to turn boundary production mechanics

REQ-SEC-004-C.title: Production Before Consumption Order

blockers.reason: Ordering rule for turn boundary processing

REQ-SEC-004-C.notes: Production ordering affects RESOURCE consumption calculations.

REQ-SEC-005.title: Sector Acquisition Action

blockers.reason: Must calculate cost before allowing acquisition
Must know available sector types for selection

REQ-SEC-005.notes: Deducts credits from RESOURCE system treasury.

REQ-SEC-006.title: Resource Cap Handling (Split)

blockers.reason: Caps apply to resources produced by sectors

REQ-SEC-006.notes: Parent spec for resource cap handling. Enforces caps defined in RESOURCE system.

REQ-SEC-006-A.title: Food Resource Cap

blockers.reason: Cap applies to Food production from Food sectors

REQ-SEC-006-A.notes: 10,000 food cap defined in coordination with RESOURCE system.

REQ-SEC-006-B.title: Ore Resource Cap

blockers.reason: Cap applies to Ore production from Ore sectors

REQ-SEC-006-B.notes: 5,000 ore cap defined in coordination with RESOURCE system.

REQ-SEC-006-C.title: Petroleum Resource Cap

blockers.reason: Cap applies to Petroleum production from Petroleum sectors

REQ-SEC-006-C.notes: 3,000 petroleum cap defined in coordination with RESOURCE system.

REQ-SEC-006-D.title: Credits Unlimited Storage

blockers.reason: No cap for Credits production from Commerce sectors

REQ-SEC-006-D.notes: Credits unlimited by design in RESOURCE system.

REQ-SEC-008.title: Special Sector Stacking

blockers.reason: Must know sector production values to calculate stacking effects

REQ-SEC-008.notes: Additive stacking applies to all sector types.

REQ-SEC-009.title: Sector Destruction in Combat (Split)

blockers.reason: Must have sectors to destroy them

REQ-SEC-009.notes: Parent spec for combat-related sector destruction. Triggered by COMBAT system.

REQ-SEC-009-A.title: Sector Destruction Formula
REQ-SEC-009-A.notes: Destruction formula uses combat overkill from COMBAT system.

REQ-SEC-009-B.title: Permanent Sector Removal

blockers.reason: Formula determines which sectors to remove permanently

REQ-SEC-009-B.notes: Database deletion prevents sector transfer snowballing.

REQ-SEC-010.title: Sector Capture on Conquest (Split)

blockers.reason: Must have sectors to transfer them
Conquest is alternative to destruction - different combat outcome

REQ-SEC-010.notes: Parent spec for conquest sector transfer. Triggered by VICTORY system conquest conditions.

REQ-SEC-010-A.title: Conquest Sector Transfer Cap
REQ-SEC-010-A.notes: 50% cap prevents excessive snowballing from conquest victories.

blockers.reason: Random selection applies to sectors within transfer cap

REQ-SEC-011.title: Research Sector Unlock

blockers.reason: Must define Research sector before gating it behind unlock

REQ-SEC-011.notes: Requires Research Tier 2 from RESEARCH system tech tree.
